subject: Harry Smith: Courage On Campus
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






April 23, 
      2007
 
Hi, 
      everybody,
 
Courage. It's taking some real courage today for the students and 
      faculty of Virginia Tech to return to their classrooms. We spoke with 
      Prof. Richard Shryock, who is the chairman 
      of the department of foreign language and literature at Virginia Tech, 
      where he has been teaching for 20 years. This morning, he was scheduled to 
      take over a class where the teacher and several students had been killed. 
      While that takes courage, Shyrock told us it's conversation with students 
      that is inspiring. 
 
A lot has changed 
      since we left Blacksburg on Thursday. Many 
      students told us they would not return to class, but there seems to be a 
      groundswell response from the Virginia Tech community to go back to school 
      and basically take back their college. We were incredibly impressed by the 
      entire Virginia Tech community last week, and we hope they can achieve 
      their goals.
 
Tomorrow, we will 
      continue our "Wedding in a Week" that was postponed because of the tragedy 
      at Virginia Tech.
 
Take 
      care,
